results.title: Mr Koumal carries the torch. Mr Koumal invents a robot. Mr Koumal flies like a bird
results.creator_credit: Sim Productions, Studio Animovaneho Filmu and Gene Deitch
results.brief_description: This series of three vignettes illustrates the ironies of life and universal human foibles. Mr Koumal is Everyman at his optimistic best.

results.title: Mr Koumal carries the torch
results.creator_credit: Sim Productions, Studio Animovaneho Filmu and Gene Deitch
results.brief_description: Mr Koumal is determined to carry a torch to its destination. He runs on and on, braving many obstacles; nothing can deter him from pursuing his task. Just when he comes within a few steps of the finishing line, a bystander trips him up, crosses the line with the torch, and wins all the glory. Animated film. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sim Productions, Studio Animovaneho Filmu and Gene Deitch

results.title: Mr Jingle at Dingley Dell
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Charles Dickens”.
On their way to Dingley Dell, Mr Pickwick and his friends meet the rascally Alfred Jingle, with his unusual telegraphic style of speech. Tells how Jingle hoodwinks them all, ingratiates himself with Miss Rachel Wardell, elopes with her in the middle of the night, and is finally apprehended by Mr Pickwick. Adapted from Charles Dickens “The Pickwick Papers”. Narrated by Fredric March.

results.title: Mr Ikegami's Flight
results.brief_description: Mr. Ikegami (Kazuhiro Muroyama) is sent to Australia from Japan on business. His task is to locate the boss’s wife whose gone missing. Speaking no English and confined mostly to his hotel room, Mr. Ikegami realises the futility of his search and longs to be back home with his expectant wife.

results.title: Mr Ikegami's flight
results.brief_description: Mr Ikegami is in Sydney on business. Back in Tokyo, his wife Seisuko is expecting their first child. A tale of divided loyalties. Features Kazuhiro Muroyama as Mr Ikegami. Japanese/English with English subtitles. Original format 35 mm

results.title: Mr Horatio Knibbles (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Mr Horatio Knibbles is a magic rabbit that only Mary Bunting can see, Mary’s mother’s jewellery goes missing but with the help of Mr. Knibbles and his friends, Squirrel Postman, Air Mail Pigeon and Mrs. Magpie, the real culprit is found. A live action fantasy. Rated: G.

results.title: Mr Horatio Knibbles
results.creator_credit: Anvil Films, Hugh Stewart and Robert Hird
results.brief_description: Mr. Horatio Knibbles is a magic rabbit that only Mary Bunting can see. Mary’s mother’s jewellery goes missing but with the help of Mr. Knibbles and his friends, Squirrel Postman, Air Mail Pigeon and Mrs. Magpie, the real culprit is found. A live action fantasy. Cast includes Anthony Shepard as Horatio Knibbles, Lesley Roach, Gary Smith, Rachel Brennock, John Ash, Nigel Chivers. From an original story by Wallace Bosco.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anvil Films, Hugh Stewart and Robert Hird

results.title: Mr Holland's opus (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Interscope communications, PolyGram Film International, Ted Field, Michael Nolin, Robert W. Cort and Stephen Herek
results.brief_description: Richard Dreyfuss plays Glen Holland, a musician who falls into a temporary teaching position at J.F. Kennedy High and stays for 30 years. The opus he composes takes second place to his great work, that of enriching the lives of his students as they pass through his class. This is not a film about a hero who performs brave deeds; but of ordinary people in everyday settings who strive daily for excellence in their lives. Dreyfuss is ably supported by Glenne Headly, Jay Thomas and Olympia Dukakis. “Mr Holland’s opus” is a sentimental, warm film which will uplift the spirit.

results.title: Mr Gruber's mystery tour (K)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Adapted from chapter 4 from the book “Paddington marches on” by Michael Bond. Mr Gruber takes Paddington on a visit to the Wax Museum where Paddington is astonished and amazed at what he sees. Paddington has never visited the Wax Musem before. Narrated by Michael Hordern.
